name: Made Beaver
description:
Made Beaver is an 18th century fur trade simulator and inventory manager. Starting with a small cabin on the coast, the objective is to build a profitable trading network across the continent of North America. Primary gameplay takes place within the Trade window, buying and selling goods and furs with hundreds of tribes, settlements, and freemen.

- Trade imported goods for furs that will later be auctioned back home. The markets can be unpredictable so plan for the worst and hope for the best.
- Manage your reputation with the tribes while also trading with their enemies.
- Upgrade to larger forts for larger trading capacities and stronger defenses against tribes with low reputation.
- Unlock double profit goods from China and the Sandwich Islands for settlements.
- Unlock the Panama Trail to shave months off transoceanic shipping times.
- Play as Canada, France, Great Britain, Netherlands, Russia, Spain, Sweden, or United States.

Some dev background:
Made Beaver is a solo development effort by a new pc game developer and the principal goal is historical accuracy. Hundreds of hours of research were committed to all aspects of the game world:
- Trade routes and travel times
- Goods and prices
- Shipping costs
- Wildlife ranges and populations
- Tribe territories and populations
- Settlement locations and populations

Development is ongoing to refine details, correct errors, and improve player experience.
